allocation_id.description: Specifies the ID of the Elastic IP address to associate with the NAT Gateway; must be an existing Elastic IP in the same region.

connectivity_type.description: Specifies the connectivity type for the NAT gateway, either "public" or "private".

private_ip.description: Specifies the private IP address to associate with the NAT gateway, must be in the subnet's CIDR block.

secondary_allocation_ids.description: List of secondary Elastic IP allocation IDs to associate with the NAT Gateway, allowing multiple public IPs for high availability or failover.

secondary_private_ip_address_count.description: Specifies the number of secondary private IP addresses to assign to the NAT Gateway's network interface; must be a non-negative integer.

secondary_private_ip_addresses.description: List of secondary private IP addresses to associate with the NAT gateway; must be valid private IPv4 addresses within the subnet's CIDR range.

subnet_id.description: ID of the subnet in which the NAT gateway will be created; must be a public subnet.

tags.description: Key-value pairs to categorize and organize the NAT gateway, supporting resource management and identification.

timeouts.description: Defines the duration for NAT Gateway creation and deletion operations, allowing customization of timeout periods to ensure proper resource management.
